required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Postoperative Catheterization Time After Stress Incontinence Surgery to Success of Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Postoperative Catheterization Time After Stress Incontinence Surgery to Voiding Dysfunction, Urinary Retention and Success of Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: After incontinence surgery, the patients randomly will be divided two groups. In group A postoperative urinary catheterization time will be applied one day, In group B catheterization will be applied two days. After removal of urinary catheter, residual volume will be measured and voiding function will be controlled. In postoperative period; third, sixth month and one year after surgery stress test will be applied to control success of surgery

primary_outcome.measure: early postoperative voiding dysfunction and urinary retention
primary_outcome.description: after removal of urinary catheter, has residual volume much more than 150cc (to be measured with urinary catheterization)

secondary_outcome.measure: The success of stress urinary incontinence surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: third month, sixth month and one year
secondary_outcome.description: third, sixth month and one year after surgery, absence of stress urinary incontinence

arm_group.description: the patient urinary catheterization after surgery; one day
the patient urinary catheterization after surgery; two day

intervention.intervention_name: to measure the residual volume after catheterization
intervention.description: after first micturition to measure the residual volume in bladder

study_pop.textblock: the women who have stress incontinence at physical examination and urodynamics tests

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- stress incontinence
- resistant to medical treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- had no surgery before
- has no accompanying uterine descensus
- has no neurogenic disorder

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
